alert.note: Alert for Bath (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 12:41PM EDT until August 06 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath, Fleming and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1240 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flemingsburg, Fairview, Poplar Plains, Goddard, Hillsboro, Wallingford, Ringos Mills, Tilton, Plummers Landing, Grange City, Oakley, Pebble, Muses Mills, Craintown, Mount Carmel, Wyoming, Pecks Ridge, Foxport, Sharkey and Sherburne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
